intro: Syrenia montana, commonly known as the mountain syrenia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Syrenia montana typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, preferring well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
